text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
This is the help guide to all SACS Security Command Codes.
MATERIAL CHANGES
This IRM 2.12.2 transmits the help guide for all the SACS Security Command Codes that are available and used by Security Officers. It contains information of the formats, their variables and
) This IRM
transmits the help guide for all the SACS Security Command Codes that are available and used by Security Officers. It contains information of the formats, their variables and their description. (
) Following addition of ADDEM, ADMAF and ADTRM in phase I, added all remaining command and their formats to this IRM as phase II. (

) Update formats for command codes ALLOW, MRUPD, SFINQ, UNLEM and UPEMP to reﬂect support of SEID, in addition to SSN for some formats of the command code requests. Also, some display and format errors from previous version.

Update formats for command codes ALLOW, MRUPD, SFINQ, UNLEM and UPEMP to reﬂect support of SEID, in addition to SSN for some formats of the command code requests. Also, correct some display and format errors from previous version.

Purpose: These sections provides information of the formats, variables and related description of SACS Security command codes.
Program Goals: Provide information of the formats, variables and related scription of SACS Security command codes.
Program Controls: The help guide is updated whenever there are new updates to the existing command code formats or when new command
pppppp is Operator Type (see Exhibit 2.12.2-1 for restric- tions).
llllll is last name (min of 2 characters - max of 20). Can not use hyphens, spaces, apostrophes, or suffixes (Jr., Sr. III,
fff is ﬁrst name (min of 1 character - max of 15)
T is Telephone Number Indicator Literal {optional}.
nnn-nnn-nnnn is telephone number digit (area code and dashes mandatory).
xNNNNN is literal x + 1-5 digit extension
MGR is manager literal {optional}.
i is Investigation Indicator: I (Investigation initiated), C (In- vestigation Completed); E (Enter on Duty).
ccode is Command Code to be added

Note: Format 3 is used for the rare occasion when you want to assign a speciﬁc 10 digit Employee Number to an IDRS user or Console user. If you specify the entire 10 digit number, the system will give that number to the user (if it is available).
Note: The Telephone Number is optional.
Operator Type is only valid for Console users.
) ADMAF can create the MPAF for a new Unit. The MPAF determines Command Codes can be given optionally to users within the Unit. (
) ADMAF can delete the MPAF for a Unit. File (
) ADMAF with a deﬁner of ’Z’ creates up to ten (

) new Units, copies the Command Code bitmaps and characteristics of the existing Unit to the Units, moves all active employees from the existing Unit to the ﬁrst new thus allowing the employees to keep their Production Command Code then deletes the existing Unit. If the ﬁrst unit is in a different campus the same Computing Center), the restrictions and bypasses for the in the old campus are copied over to the new campus. The Revenue and
Receipt Book User restrictions and bypasses are deleted for the employees at the old campus. (
) ADMAF with a deﬁner of ’U’ creates up to ten (
) new Units, and Command Code bitmaps and characteristics of an existing Unit to the Units. (
) Create MPAF for a new unit MPAF Format: ADMAF uuuuu ccode ccode ccode ccode ccode ccode Where: uuuuu is Unit Number
ADMAF can create the MPAF for a new Unit. The MPAF determines what Command Codes can be given optionally to users within the Unit.

A screen of Command Codes can be entered with the ADMAF command. If it is necessary for there to be more Command Codes in the MPAF, you can use UPMAF to add as many as desired. If the Unit number starts with 98 or 99, then the command codes must be Console command codes.
Create new units by copying command code bitmaps and characteristics existing unit
ADMAFduuuuu nnnnn nnnnn nnnnn nnnnn
nnnnn is New Unit Number (from 1 to 10 unit numbers delimited by a space).

Note: The old Unit MUST exist. The new Unit MUST NOT exist. The new Units will have the same MPAF, UCCP, REROUTE and TRDB as the old Unit. With a deﬁner of ’Z’, all active employees will automatically be moved to the new Unit and will keep their Production Command Code Proﬁles (see Note
), and the old Unit will be deleted.

Note: Format 1 authorizes a terminal’s access to the SACS network. The time On/ Off ﬁelds are expressed in military time (0001 - 2400). A TMADD entry must be entered on the TPF machine to establish network conﬁguration.
Note: Format 2 authorizes multiple terminal’s access to the SACS network.

INVALID TSID - NOT IN SDI
THE TERMINAL ID IS ALREADY IN THE AUTHORIZATION FILE
UNABLE TO PROCESS - MAX TERMINALS LIMIT EXCEEDED
THE TERMINAL ID IS CURRENTLY IN THE TERMINAL FILE

d is Deﬁner A (user role Revenue Agent), M (user role Manual Refund. Authorizer), R (user role 809 Receipt Book User), or U (user role Remittance Perfection
nn is Number of days the bypass is effective (01 to
mm/dd/yyyy is Calendar date the bypass will be removed (Note: the bypass is the morning of this date).
ACTIVATE is Literal for activate bypass option.
Note: Bypasses can only be added if the user role is restricted for the speciﬁed campus.
Note: If Format 1a is used, the date of input counts as the ﬁrst day.
Note: If Format 1b is used, the calendar date input cannot be later than 14 days from today.
Note: Bypasses remain active if an employee changes units within the same campus during the effective period.
Note: An employee can have up to 5 bypasses at a time per campus (equal to the maximum allowable number of restrictions).
Note: If the employee is signed on when Format 1 is input, he/she must sign off then sign on again before the changes take effect.
d is Deﬁner A (user role Revenue Agent), M (user role Manual Refund Authorizer), R (user role 809 Receipt Book User), or U (user role Remittance Perfection
Note: If Format 2 is not input, the bypass will be removed automatically by on the scheduled removal date.
Note: If the employee is signed on when Format 2 is input, he/she must sign off then sign on again before the changes take effect.

) CMODE allows authorized users to switch from their Home Location to an thorized Foreign Location. At the same time, it changes their terminal association to the corresponding location and their default IDRS Command Code routing to that location. The routing of CFOL commands is not affected. (
) CMODE is also used to change back to the Home Location or to a different Foreign Location. (

) Employees cannot execute security Command Codes from a Foreign except for CMODE, SFDIS, SINOF and STATS. If an employee signs off (SINOF) from a terminal while using their foreign number, their employee status and terminal status will be reset to the Home Location. (
) Change Mode to a Different Service Center Format: CMODEaaa Where: aaa = acronym of the destination location code --
or
(05-13-2021) CMODE - Change to a Different Service Center
Note: Employees cannot change mode to a Campus or Field Office until they have been given access to that location (see UPEMP with identiﬁer ‘S’ ).
sc is Campus ID, Campus number, or Office Identiﬁer **
Note: This entry displays a list of all the terminals that have not been used in the last 6 months.
Note: The terminal PID is in nnn/nnn format. The number to the left of the slash is the PID’s decimal number; to the right of the slash is the same PID’s hexa- decimal number.
Note: ** See DISCC for a list of the Campus IDs/numbers and Office IDs.

DISCC displays the attribute settings of Command Codes on the Security Command Code Table (CCT) in SACS. It is a Command Code which IDRS users with the same functionality as the SACS Operator Command CCDIS.
Display the Command Code attributes of a speciﬁc command code.
Displays a listing of all the command codes and their attributes in SACS Command Code Table.
Displays a listing of all the Command Codes and their attributes are processed on the speciﬁed host processor.
Displays a listing of those Command Codes which match ALL of the speciﬁed attributes.
Displays a listing of enabled or disabled Command Codes at the speciﬁed Campus. Display the Command Code attributes of a speciﬁc Command Code

DISCC displays the attribute settings of Command Codes on the Security Command Code Table (CCT) in SACS. It is a Command Code which provides IDRS users with the same functionality as the SACS Operator Command CCDIS.

PDSY - Displayable at PDSN - Displayable at Campus No; (Display Campus Yes; (Display ONLY at NCC Yes) ONLY at NCC No) SVCY - Displayable at SVCN - Displayable at Campus Yes Campus No SENY - Sensitive Yes SENN - Sensitive No SECY - Security Officer SECN - Security Officer Only Yes Only No SUNY - Sunday Available SUNN - Sunday Available Yes No SGNY - SINON Required SGNY - SINON Required Yes Yes TNGY - Training Database TNGN - Training Database Yes No PRIY - Primary PRIN - Primary Commmand Yes Commmand No PROY - Proﬁle Required PRON - Proﬁle Required Yes No XTTY - Time Exempted XTTN - Time Exempted No Yes PPGY - Preserve Pages PPGN - Preserve Pages Yes No MFEY - Multi Function MFEN - Multi Function Equip Yes Equip No USRY - Unit Security Rep USRN - Unit Security Rep Yes No RRTY - Reroutable Yes RRTN - Reroutable No TINY - TIN standard TINN - TIN standard position Yes position No

PDSY - Displayable at PDSN - Displayable at Campus No; (Display Campus Yes; (Display ONLY at NCC Yes) ONLY at NCC No) XDLY - Exempt from XDLN - Exempt from Deletion Yes Deletion No TIF1 - TIF Command TIFN - TIF Command Code, Group 1 No TIF2 - TIF Command Code, Group 2 TIF3 - TIF Command Code, Group 3 TIF4 - TIF Command Code, Group 4
Note: Format 4a displays an alpha-order listing of those Command Codes which match ALL of the speciﬁed attributes. Format 4b produces the same list in numeric order.
Note: Attributes which are omitted are ignored, allowing Command Codes with both yes and no settings for that attribute to be on the list.
Note: If conﬂicting attributes are entered, such as both SENY and SENN, an error message is returned to the user.
stat is the literal ″ENBL″ for enabled Command Codes OR ″DSBL″ for disabled Command Codes.
sc is Campus ID, Campus number, or Office Identiﬁer (OID).
Valid Campus IDs / SC numbers / OIDs are:

Note: The Campus can be speciﬁed by its ID, by its number, or by its Office Identi- ﬁer (OID).
For example, DISCC ALPHA ENBL PH and DISCC ALPHA ENBL 28 DISCC ALPHA ENBL 05 will produce the same results.
) DISGR can display a list of all the Command Code Group names. (
) DISGR can display a list of all Command Codes within a speciﬁc Command Code Group.

) DISNC displays network conﬁguration information on SACS terminals, data lines, and sites. DISNC is an IDRS user Command Code which provides the same functionality as the SACS Operator Command NCDIS. (
) Users may display information about single network resources using the Terminal Security ID, or the Terminal PID, or the Location ID of a terminal or site. (
) Users may also display multiple resources by Resource type (line, site or terminal), or by Connection type. (
) Display information about single network resources
Users may display information about single network resources using the Terminal Security ID, or the Terminal PID, or the Location ID of a terminal
iiii(iiii) is Location ID. (4-6 characters for Sites; 8 characters for Terminals).

Note: Format 1b display the conﬁguration of the site or device of the queried PID.
Note: Format 1c displays the conﬁguration of the site or the terminal at the queried location.
Note: Format 1c displays the conﬁguration of the site or the terminal at the queried

) MRINQ can display employee history information, using a Social Security Number key, an Employee Number key, or a Standard Employee Identiﬁer (SEID) key. (
) MRINQ can display limited information for an employee when using the Social Security Number key (just the SEID, phone number, and investigation date). (
) MRINQ can display the next available Employee Number. (
) MRINQ can display a list of all Employee Numbers for a given Office Identiﬁer and Sequence Number. (

) MRUPD can update a user’s Social Security Number, their Investigation and date, or their Assignment or Origin dates. (

Instructions - IDRS Password Management Activation
While signed onto IDRS, enter the command code “PWACT” and transmit key. Note: Command code PWACT is available to all IDRS does not need to be in your IDRS proﬁle. Answer
Questions and remember the answers for future use:
Provide the last name of a childhood friend Note: all alpha, between
characters in length.
Provide a signiﬁcant date – other than your birthday Note: all numeric, use MMDDYYYY format, date range from
Provide a favorite color Note: all alpha, between
characters in length.
Provide a signiﬁcant year Note: all numeric, use YYYY format, year range from
Note: all numeric, use YYYY format, year range from 1800-2999.
Security and (
) • REQUEST COMPLETED - Password Management has been fully implemented. • Any other response - Transaction failed at least one edit check. Try again. (
Additional information also is available by entering PWACT HELP while signed onto IDRS. (
After you have responded to the four inquiries, select the transmit key. not send this screen with your responses to a printer. (

If you have properly responded to the four inquiries, you will receive a REQUEST COMPLETED message at the bottom of your screen. This message indicates that your Password Management Capability has been cessfully activated. We recommend that you perform a SFDISP <transmit> transaction to check your PSWD MGT status. If you have successfully activated this capability, your status will be identiﬁed as ACTIVE. (

You can change your inquiry responses at any time you are signed-on to IDRS by repeating the steps above. If you change a response, you must respond to all four inquiries again or you will de-activate your capability. will never show your previous responses but you can re-enter a previous response. (

If you do not receive the REQUEST COMPLETED message, you must follow all the above steps and respond to four inquiries. If you continue to have problems, contact your IDRS Unit Security Representative (USR). (
) IDRS Password Management capability that will enable IDRS users who forgotten their IDRS password to get a new temporary IDRS password without having to submit an Online

request. To use this capability, you must activate the IDRS Password Management capability (PWACT) while signed onto IDRS. After the capability has been activated, if you have forgotten your IDRS password you can use this feature to create a new temporary IDRS password which will then let you create a new user Note: PWMGT will not allow IDRS access to a user who has other access im-
REQUEST COMPLETED
Password Management has been fully implemented. Any other response
Transaction failed at least one edit check. Try again.
3. After you have responded to the four inquiries, select the transmit key. Do not send this screen with your responses to a printer.
IDRS Password Management capability that will enable IDRS users who have forgotten their IDRS password to get a new temporary IDRS password without having to submit an Online

request. To use this capability, you must activate the IDRS Password Management capability (PWACT) while signed onto IDRS. After the capability has been activated, if you have forgotten your IDRS password you can use this feature to create a new temporary IDRS password which will then let you create a new user password.
Note: PWMGT will not allow IDRS access to a user who has other access im- pediments, i.e. locked workstation, locked proﬁle, deleted proﬁle.
An erroneous ’signiﬁcant year’ is entered in the PWMGT space of the SINON template. Non
numeric entered in ’signiﬁcant year’ in the PWMGT space of the SINON template.

REPTS authorizes user access to the SACS security reports application IORS via SACS. Users must login to IORS using their SACS login information (SEID, Last Name, First Initial, password). SACS provides user authentication, making sure the user is proﬁled with REPTS and has an active user account in SACS before allowing them access to IORS. SACS also provides the preliminary
Security Command Codes Help Guide 2.12.2 page
security checks to ensure the user access request is issued from an autho- rized IORS server/terminal. An Audit Trail Record will be produced for all IORS login inputs made using REPTS.
login inputs made using REPTS. (

) Command code RMODE authorizes an employee to use the command contained in their Training Proﬁle in a Research Mode. Employees should contact their USR for instructions on modifying their Training Proﬁle. (
) The Research Mode differs from Production Mode in that production ﬁles accessed but not updated. It differs from Training Mode in that the training are not accessed. (

) The Research Mode is to be used only by: a. IDRS User Support staff for researching production problems that can resolved only by accessing production data. b. Application Development staff for addressing issues that can be only by accessing production data. Application Development staff use shall be in compliance with IRM
Sensitive But Unclassiﬁed Data Policy. Application development staff shall meet all IRM
quirements (including SBU Data Use approval) before RMODE will be granted. c. Treasury Inspector General for Tax Administration (TIGTA) Strategic forcement Division staff. (
) In order to use the research capability, a user shall have command code RMODE in their Production Proﬁle, and input command code S
ON with a Production/Training Indicator of R. (
) An Audit Trail Record will be produced for all inputs made in the Research Mode. (
) All Research Mode security violations will be included in IDRS security (

) RSTRK (meaning restrict) prevents an IDRS user with a certain role type from having speciﬁed command codes in their proﬁle. Restrictions added under an Office Identiﬁer can not be removed by security personnel in another Officer Identiﬁer. Restrictions added on a campus in the same computing center will update to the employee proﬁle on the active campus. Restrictions added under an Office Identiﬁer can not be removed by security personnel in another Officer Identiﬁer. account, will need to be manually updated by security personnel. RSTRK can be added to the employee data base for an employee SSN who has no active

be added to the employee data base for an employee SSN who has no IDRS account. RSTRK can add and delete restrictions against a employee’s proﬁle for a campus. ) SFDIS allows users to display their own Proﬁles. The response to this command will include the user’s current (signed on) proﬁle, the Info-connect ID, the user’s active restriction/bypasses, password management activation status and availability, individual Command Code proﬁle and authorized Foreign Locations for CMODE. User must be signed on in ″T″ mode to view his/her training proﬁle.
(05-13-2021) SFDIS - Display User Proﬁle
Where: d is deﬁner, either P or T will display the user’s current (signed on) proﬁle, the three options being Production, Training, or Research.
Note: SFDIS displays the user’s Command Code Proﬁle for either Training or Pro- duction. Command Codes followed by a dollar sign ($) are exempt from automatic deletion for non-use.
Note: If deﬁner ’P’ is selected, the display will also include the File Access Restric- tion (″IMF only″, ″BMF only″, or ″IMF and BMF″). There is no File Access Restriction for training.
tion (″IMF only″, ″BMF only″, or ″IMF and BMF″). There is no File Access Restriction for training. (

) SFINQ can display employee information such as name, Employee SEID, user type, locked or unlocked status, active/inactive restrictions and bypasses, authorized foreign access, NULL status and password status. (
) SFINQ can display the employee’s Production or Training Command Code Proﬁles. (

) SFINQ can display all employees in a Unit in Employee Number order or order, show their SEID, Operator Type, whether signed on or off, the TSID the terminal if signed on, and their locked or unlocked status. (
) SFINQ can display all Command Codes allowed in a Unit plus the Unit’s Universal Access (reroute) status. (
) SFINQ can display for one or more Units a list of all employees’ names, Employee Numbers, NULL Status, and authorized Foreign Locations Office Identiﬁers (OIDs). (
) SFINQ can display, by terminal TSID, the employee number for any user signed on, or the allowed Time On/Off for that terminal. (
) SFINQ can display a list of the last usage dates for all Command Codes in particular Unit, plus indicate which Command Codes have been turned off non-use. (
) SFINQ can display authorized Multiple Access (CMODE) locations. (
) Finally, this SFINQ displays Command Codes turned off for a Unit. This has six different options: (
) Display LAST
days for BOTH System and Security Officer turn-offs. (
) Display LAST
days for EITHER System or Security Officer turn-offs. (
) Display ALL dates for BOTH System and Security Officer turn-offs. (
) Display ALL dates for EITHER System or Security Officer turn-offs. (
) Display SPECIFIED NUMBER of days for BOTH System and Security turn-offs. (
) Display SPECIFIED NUMBER of days for EITHER System or Security turn-offs. (
) Display Password Management Status for a unit - SFINQW.

SINON is used to access the IDRS system. SINON is used to retrieve the template or to actually sign on using the CASL macro.
Security Command Codes Help Guide 2.12.2
Note: TRDB users who have dual-SINON capability will receive additional warnings when they sign on to their second terminal. TRDB users must sign off of both terminals individually.
Note: TRDB users who try to sign on a third terminal without signing off of one of the other two terminals, will automatically be signed off of every terminal and have their Employee Proﬁle locked.
Note: TRDB users may change their password from either session.

) UPEMP can change an employee (user) name, their Unit Number, their Programmer type (in Test only), their TRDB status, their Standard Identiﬁer (SEID), or their telephone number. (
) UPEMP can add / delete Command Code(s) to / from the user’s Proﬁle. option also displays and changes their IMF - BMF status. (
) UPEMP can lock or unlock a user’s Proﬁle (unlocks system lock, security or self lock) or delete a user. (
) UPEMP can delete an authorized Foreign Location. (
) UPEMP can perform workload maintenence functions. (
) UPEMP can delete an employee’s proﬁle. (
) Employees’ access to multiple databases is controlled by using UPEMP to Foreign (secondary) Locations. (
) Multi-Access employees can have their Command Code Proﬁle set to their Home Campus. (
) Change an employee (user) name, their Unit Number, their SAT or mer type (in Test only), their TRDB status, their Standard Employee (SEID), or their telephone number

Format 2:
UPMAFLuuuuu x uuuuu x uuuuu x uuuuu x uuuuu x
uuuuu is the Unit Number (up to 5 units).
x is L for lock or U for Unlock.

Note: This format allows for the locking and unlocking of up to 5 units. The purpose of locking a unit is that no employees can be added to the unit, moved in or from the unit. Employees may be deleted from a locked unit. The SFINQM and SFINQU screens now include information on the current lock status. The literal LOCKED =YES or LOCKED = NO appears on the second line. The default is ″No″.

units. The purpose of locking a unit is that no employees can be added to the unit, moved in or from the unit. Employees may be deleted from a locked unit. UPTRM changes the permanent or temporary Time On/Off parameters for terminal.
